results.title: [Pathe colour: hand stencil example]
results.brief_description: A segment from an early silent film, illustrating the technique of hand colouration. The film’s captions read “At the castle of Oursel. The dungeon of doom. The dungeon of despair”. No further credits available.

results.title: Passing Era of the Steam Horse
results.brief_description: Steam locomotives have been replaced by diesels on the Victorian Railways. Their history in the system is briefly covered, and various types are shown in operation, concluding with the narrow gauge service from Ferntree Gully to Gembrook being restored as a tourist feature.

results.title: Passage through The Wall
results.brief_description: A report on the short period when West Berliners were allowed to visit their relatives in East Berlin, Christmas 1963. It was the first time after more than two years that they were able to do so. East Berliners are sill not allowed to visit East Berlin.
results.description: A report on the short period when West Berliners were allowed to visit their relatives in East Berlin, Christmas 1963. It was the first time after more than two years that they were able to do so. East Berliners are sill not allowed to visit East Berlin.

results.title: Parks are for people, but...
results.brief_description: Considers some of the environmental problems resulting from the use of parks by people in their various activities. Takes, as an example, Kosciusko State Park in the Snowy Mountains and the problems it represents for the management of the park. Cast includes Margaret Newport, Frances Miller, Anne Miller, Geoff Drummond, Peter Hunt, Pat Drummond. Director, photographer, editor: Damon Smith; photographer: Karen Wynn; sound: Peter Moylan; music: Pat Drummond, Peter Hunt; songs: John Polson; commentary: Martin Williams.

results.title: A Park community
results.brief_description: The park is a natural ecosystem within the city. Plants are the producers, using energy from the sun to produce food by photosynthesis. Animals are the consumers; mushrooms are decomposers. man contributes by mowing the grass and pruning the trees and shrubs to substitute for grazing and browsing animals that are not there, he also fertilizes to supplement natural decay, and waters to supplement natural rainfall. These inter-relationships are examined and a pattern of observation for exploring a local park is thus provided.

results.title: Paris: the city and the people
results.brief_description: Uses a dialogue between a visiting American and a Parisian to provide the framework for a visual tour of Paris. Shows how a combination of French culture, industrial progress and economic growth has made Paris into a great capital. Includes views of the Eiffel Tower, the Cathedral of Notre Dame de Paris, and the Arc de Triomphe.

results.title: Rediscovery: art media - paper mache
results.brief_description: Presents the basic process involved in sculpting and creating 3-D forms using paper mache - one of the cheapest and easiest ways of creating objects. Jewelry, toy houses, elephants, birds etc - from paper strips to paper mulch students develop their own creative ideas. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Palaeolithic man
results.brief_description: Illustrates the way of life of palaeolithic hunters and food gatherers, based on three sources of evidence that remain today - weapons and implements found near their primitive hearths, drawings from European cave settlements and the nomadic lives of some Australian First Nations peoples.

results.title: Pakistan: a two-part nation
results.creator_credit: Suzanne Talbot Isaacs and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description: A study of East and West Pakistan, this film views the problems which arise from differences in people, geography and economy, between the two. Amidst uncertainty that threatens progress, the two Pakistans are held together by their religious tie of Islam.
results.description: A study of East and West Pakistan, this film views the problems which arise from differences in people, geography and economy, between the two. Amidst uncertainty that threatens progress, the two Pakistans are held together by their religious tie of Islam.

results.title: Painting reflections in water
results.brief_description: This is the first of a series of films made in collaboration with Eliot O’Hara, distinguished American art teacher and artist. We see O’Hara painting the complete sketch, from blocking the composition in charcoal, applying water with a broad brush, until finally the artist has painted a bright picture that seems as “wet” as the harbour where it was painted, so naturalistic is O’Hara’s technique. This is a “how-to-do-it film”, the purpose of which is to demonstrate one particular artist’s technique not to indicate critical principles or aesthetic standards.
